The seventh season of _[The Walking Dead](/wiki/The_Walking_Dead_\(TV_series\)
"The Walking Dead \(TV series\)")_ , an American [post-
apocalyptic](/wiki/Apocalyptic_and_post-apocalyptic_fiction "Apocalyptic and
post-apocalyptic fiction") [horror](/wiki/Horror_fiction "Horror fiction")
[television series](/wiki/Television_series "Television series") on
[AMC](/wiki/AMC_\(TV_channel\) "AMC \(TV channel\)"), premiered on October 23,
2016, and concluded on April 2, 2017, consisting of 16 episodes.[1][2]
Developed for television by [Frank Darabont](/wiki/Frank_Darabont "Frank
Darabont"), the series is based on the [eponymous series of comic
books](/wiki/The_Walking_Dead_\(comic_book\) "The Walking Dead \(comic
book\)") by [Robert Kirkman](/wiki/Robert_Kirkman "Robert Kirkman"), [Tony
Moore](/wiki/Tony_Moore_\(artist\) "Tony Moore \(artist\)"), and [Charlie
Adlard](/wiki/Charlie_Adlard "Charlie Adlard"). The executive producers are
Kirkman, David Alpert, [Scott M. Gimple](/wiki/Scott_M._Gimple "Scott M.
Gimple"), [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero"), [Tom
Luse](/wiki/Tom_Luse "Tom Luse"), and [Gale Anne Hurd](/wiki/Gale_Anne_Hurd
"Gale Anne Hurd"), with Gimple as [showrunner](/wiki/Showrunner "Showrunner")
for the fourth consecutive season. The seventh season received mixed reviews
by critics. It was nominated for multiple awards and won three, including
[Best Horror Television
Series](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Horror_Television_Series "Saturn Award for
Best Horror Television Series") for the second consecutive year, at the [43rd
Saturn Awards](/wiki/43rd_Saturn_Awards "43rd Saturn Awards").[3]

This season adapts material from issues #100–114 of the comic book series and
focuses on the oppressive group of survivors known as the Saviors, led by the
vindictive [Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan") ([Jeffrey Dean
Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan")). Negan uses numbers,
power and lethal brutality to coerce [Rick Grimes](/wiki/Rick_Grimes "Rick
Grimes") ([Andrew Lincoln](/wiki/Andrew_Lincoln "Andrew Lincoln")), his group
of survivors, and the Alexandria Safe-Zone to make regular offerings of
supplies and weapons for the Saviors. Eventually, Rick and his group seek
allies to help them confront Negan, including members of the survivor
communities of the Hilltop, the Kingdom, Oceanside, and the Scavengers, who
have had their own dealings with Negan and the Saviors.[4]

### Main
cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Main cast")]

The seventh season features twenty series regulars overall. For the [season
premiere](/wiki/The_Day_Will_Come_When_You_Won%27t_Be "The Day Will Come When
You Won't Be"), [Jeffrey Dean Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean
Morgan") and [Austin Amelio](/wiki/Austin_Amelio "Austin Amelio") were
promoted to series regular status, with Morgan added to the opening credits
and Amelio listed under "Also starring". After the first episode aired, the
cast faced numerous changes: [Steven Yeun](/wiki/Steven_Yeun "Steven Yeun")
and [Michael Cudlitz](/wiki/Michael_Cudlitz "Michael Cudlitz") were removed
from the opening credits, while [Alanna Masterson](/wiki/Alanna_Masterson
"Alanna Masterson"), [Josh McDermitt](/wiki/Josh_McDermitt "Josh McDermitt")
and [Christian Serratos](/wiki/Christian_Serratos "Christian Serratos") were
added to the opening credits, respectively, after previously being credited as
"Also starring", in the [second episode](/wiki/The_Well_\(The_Walking_Dead\)
"The Well \(The Walking Dead\)") onwards. [Tom
Payne](/wiki/Tom_Payne_\(actor\) "Tom Payne \(actor\)") and [Xander
Berkeley](/wiki/Xander_Berkeley "Xander Berkeley") were also promoted to
series regulars in the second episode and beyond.

####
Starring[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Starring")]

  * [Andrew Lincoln](/wiki/Andrew_Lincoln "Andrew Lincoln") as [Rick Grimes](/wiki/Rick_Grimes "Rick Grimes"), the series' [protagonist](/wiki/Protagonist "Protagonist") and leader of Alexandria, who is forced to adapt under the rule of Negan.[5]
  * [Norman Reedus](/wiki/Norman_Reedus "Norman Reedus") as [Daryl Dixon](/wiki/Daryl_Dixon "Daryl Dixon"), the group's primary hunter and a recruiter for Alexandria.[5]
  * [Steven Yeun](/wiki/Steven_Yeun "Steven Yeun") as [Glenn Rhee](/wiki/Glenn_Rhee "Glenn Rhee"), Maggie's resourceful husband, who stands as the group's moral compass.[5]1
  * [Lauren Cohan](/wiki/Lauren_Cohan "Lauren Cohan") as [Maggie Rhee](/wiki/Maggie_Greene "Maggie Greene"), Glenn's strong-willed and pregnant wife.[5]
  * [Chandler Riggs](/wiki/Chandler_Riggs "Chandler Riggs") as [Carl Grimes](/wiki/Carl_Grimes "Carl Grimes"), Rick's teenage son, who struggles to maintain his renewed morality that he achieved from residing in Alexandria.[5]
  * [Danai Gurira](/wiki/Danai_Gurira "Danai Gurira") as [Michonne](/wiki/Michonne "Michonne"), a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana")-wielding warrior, who has opened up from her previous solitary life and has recently begun a relationship with Rick.[5]
  * [Melissa McBride](/wiki/Melissa_McBride "Melissa McBride") as [Carol Peletier](/wiki/Carol_Peletier "Carol Peletier"), an empowered member of the group, whose several tragedies force her to question her ruthless methods.[5]
  * [Michael Cudlitz](/wiki/Michael_Cudlitz "Michael Cudlitz") as [Sgt. Abraham Ford](/wiki/Abraham_Ford "Abraham Ford"), a former military sergeant, whose reevaluation of his life led him to break up with Rosita and pursue Sasha.[5]1
  * [Lennie James](/wiki/Lennie_James "Lennie James") as [Morgan Jones](/wiki/Morgan_Jones_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Morgan Jones \(The Walking Dead\)"), the first survivor Rick had ever encountered, who is questioning the pacifist philosophy he had adopted.[5]
  * [Sonequa Martin-Green](/wiki/Sonequa_Martin-Green "Sonequa Martin-Green") as [Sasha Williams](/wiki/Sasha_Williams_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Sasha Williams \(The Walking Dead\)"), a former firefighter, Abraham's girlfriend and a guard of Alexandria, who has overcome various traumas.[5]
  * [Alanna Masterson](/wiki/Alanna_Masterson "Alanna Masterson") as [Tara Chambler](/wiki/Tara_Chambler "Tara Chambler"), a caring member of the group, who found a community named Oceanside and struggles to keep it a secret.[5]
  * [Josh McDermitt](/wiki/Josh_McDermitt "Josh McDermitt") as [Eugene Porter](/wiki/Eugene_Porter "Eugene Porter"), a survivor, who struggles to prove his worth to the group after lying to them about knowing a possible cure to the walker virus.[5]
  * [Christian Serratos](/wiki/Christian_Serratos "Christian Serratos") as [Rosita Espinosa](/wiki/Rosita_Espinosa "Rosita Espinosa"), a pragmatic and protective member of the group, and ex-girlfriend of Abraham.[5]
  * [Jeffrey Dean Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan") as [Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan"), the manipulative and totalitarian leader of the Saviors who served as the primary [antagonist](/wiki/Antagonist "Antagonist") of the season.[5]

#### Also
starring[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Also starring")]

  * [Seth Gilliam](/wiki/Seth_Gilliam "Seth Gilliam") as [Gabriel Stokes](/wiki/Gabriel_Stokes_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gabriel Stokes \(The Walking Dead\)"), a [priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), who has managed to earn the group's trust after previously betraying them.[5]
  * [Ross Marquand](/wiki/Ross_Marquand "Ross Marquand") as [Aaron](/wiki/Aaron_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Aaron \(The Walking Dead\)"), an Alexandrian recruiter, who brought Rick's group to Alexandria and serves as a bridge between the two factions.[5]
  * [Austin Nichols](/wiki/Austin_Nichols "Austin Nichols") as Spencer Monroe, a guard of Alexandria and the only surviving member of his family.[5]
  * [Austin Amelio](/wiki/Austin_Amelio "Austin Amelio") as [Dwight](/wiki/Dwight_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Dwight \(The Walking Dead\)"), a ruthless, reluctant member of the Saviors and one of Negan's top lieutenants, who forms a hostile rivalry with Daryl.[5]
  * [Tom Payne](/wiki/Tom_Payne_\(actor\) "Tom Payne \(actor\)") as [Paul "Jesus" Rovia](/wiki/Paul_%22Jesus%22_Monroe "Paul "Jesus" Monroe"), a scout for the Hilltop Colony, who introduced Rick's group to their compound.[5]
  * [Xander Berkeley](/wiki/Xander_Berkeley "Xander Berkeley") as [Gregory](/wiki/Gregory_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gregory \(The Walking Dead\)"), the selfish and arrogant leader of the Hilltop Colony.[5]

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: Production")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/08/The_Walking_Dead_Season_7_SDCC.jpg/400px-
The_Walking_Dead_Season_7_SDCC.jpg)](/wiki/File:The_Walking_Dead_Season_7_SDCC.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:The_Walking_Dead_Season_7_SDCC.jpg "Enlarge")

The promotional poster for the season at the [San Diego Comic-
Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego Comic-Con")

_The Walking Dead_ was renewed by AMC for a 16-episode seventh season on
October 30, 2015.[10] Filming for season 7 began in
[Georgia](/wiki/Georgia_\(U.S._state\) "Georgia \(U.S. state\)") on May 2,
2016 and concluded on November 18, 2016.[11][12] Actors [Jeffrey Dean
Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan"), [Xander
Berkeley](/wiki/Xander_Berkeley "Xander Berkeley"), [Tom
Payne](/wiki/Tom_Payne_\(actor\) "Tom Payne \(actor\)"), and [Austin
Amelio](/wiki/Austin_Amelio "Austin Amelio") were all promoted to series
regulars for the seventh season, after having recurring roles in the sixth
season.[5] The seventh season has featured several extended episodes, running
longer than its usual 43-minute running time (without commercials). Extended
episodes have ranged from 46 to 62 minutes in length.[13][14]

The finale was dedicated in memory of American [comic
artist](/wiki/Comics_artist "Comics artist") [Bernie
Wrightson](/wiki/Bernie_Wrightson "Bernie Wrightson"), who died on March 18,
2017.[15]

##
Episodes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Episodes")]

See also: [List of The Walking Dead
episodes](/wiki/List_of_The_Walking_Dead_episodes "List of The Walking Dead
episodes")

No.  
overall | No. in  
season | Title | Directed by | Written by | Original air date | U.S. viewers  
(millions)  
---|---|---|---|---|---|---  
84 | 1 | "[The Day Will Come When You Won't Be](/wiki/The_Day_Will_Come_When_You_Won%27t_Be "The Day Will Come When You Won't Be")" | [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero") | [Scott M. Gimple](/wiki/Scott_M._Gimple "Scott M. Gimple") | October 23, 2016 (2016-10-23) | 17.03[16]  
Negan's victim is revealed to be Abraham, who is beaten to death in front of
Rick's group. Daryl punches Negan out of anger, prompting Negan to also murder
Glenn. After several tests, Negan ultimately breaks Rick's resolve by nearly
forcing him to hack off Carl's arm. Negan and his crew then leave with Daryl
as hostage, while Sasha volunteers to take Maggie to Hilltop to recover, along
with the bodies of Glenn and Abraham.  
85 | 2 | "[The Well](/wiki/The_Well_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "The Well \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Greg Nicotero | Matthew Negrete | October 30, 2016 (2016-10-30) | 12.46[17]  
Carol and Morgan arrive at the Kingdom, a well-established community run by
flamboyant former zookeeper "King" Ezekiel. The Kingdom, like Hilltop, has
been producing for the Saviors under the threat of violence, although Ezekiel
has kept this arrangement secret from most residents of the Kingdom. Carol
recuperates and eagerly prepares to abandon the community, but opts to stay in
an isolated house nearby after bonding with Ezekiel.  
86 | 3 | "[The Cell](/wiki/The_Cell_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "The Cell \(The Walking Dead\)")" | [Alrick Riley](/wiki/Alrick_Riley "Alrick Riley") | [Angela Kang](/wiki/Angela_Kang "Angela Kang") | November 6, 2016 (2016-11-06) | 11.72[18]  
Daryl is locked in a cell at the Sanctuary, where Negan and Dwight constantly
torture him in an effort to break him down to obedience. Negan sends Dwight on
a mission to retrieve an escaped Savior, who says he would rather die than
return to the Sanctuary. Dwight, therefore, ultimately mercy-kills the man.
Daryl is given the opportunity to become a Savior but adamantly refuses.  
87 | 4 | "[Service](/wiki/Service_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Service \(The Walking Dead\)")" | [David Boyd](/wiki/David_Boyd_\(cinematographer\) "David Boyd \(cinematographer\)") | Corey Reed | November 13, 2016 (2016-11-13) | 11.40[19]  
As the grieving survivors struggle to come to terms with life under Negan's
rule, Negan and the Saviors arrive at Alexandria days ahead of schedule for
their first offering and take most of Alexandria's furniture and medicine, and
all their firearms. Feeling powerless, Rick informs the survivors that he is
no longer in charge and they must learn to live by Negan's terms. Rosita finds
an empty cartridge case and brings it to Eugene, tasking him to craft a loaded
cartridge for a gun she found in the woods.  
88 | 5 | "[Go Getters](/wiki/Go_Getters "Go Getters")" | [Darnell Martin](/wiki/Darnell_Martin "Darnell Martin") | Channing Powell | November 20, 2016 (2016-11-20) | 11.00[20]  
Carl accompanies Enid to Hilltop to visit Maggie, who is recovering there with
Sasha. Gregory is furious with Maggie and Sasha for not fulfilling their deal
to kill the Saviors, and demands they leave. However, after they help defend
Hilltop from a walker attack, Jesus convinces Gregory to let them stay. While
the Saviors raid Hilltop's supplies, Sasha asks Jesus if he can find where
Negan lives, which he agrees to do. Jesus then sneaks onto one of the Saviors'
trucks, where he finds Carl hiding.  
89 | 6 | "[Swear](/wiki/Swear_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Swear \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Michael E. Satrazemis | [David Leslie Johnson](/wiki/David_Leslie_Johnson "David Leslie Johnson") | November 27, 2016 (2016-11-27) | 10.40[21]  
Two weeks after the attack at the Saviors' satellite station outpost, Tara is
separated from Heath when she falls off a bridge during a walker attack. She
washes up on a beach, where she is revived by a girl named Cyndie. Tara
follows Cyndie to her community, Oceanside, a secluded group consisting of
heavily-armed women and children; any men in the group had been slaughtered by
the Saviors. Cyndie helps Tara find her way back to Alexandria and makes her
swear to never mention Oceanside to anyone.

Upon nearing the Sanctuary, Jesus jumps off the Saviors' truck to recon the
area, but Carl stays behind to kill Negan on his own. Dwight subdues Carl, but
Negan is impressed by Carl's bravery and tours him around Sanctuary. Rosita
and Eugene manage to craft a live cartridge, while Spencer scavenges for
supplies in the woods. Upon returning to Alexandria, the trio finds Negan and
the Saviors are there.

With help from Jesus and an anonymous source, Daryl finally escapes from the
Sanctuary. During a discussion about Rick's leadership, Negan guts and kills
Spencer, enraging Rosita, who shoots at Negan but hits Lucille instead. As
punishment, Arat kills Olivia. Negan and the Saviors then leave with Eugene as
hostage. After a talk with Michonne, Rick is finally motivated to fight the
Saviors. Rick's group travels to Hilltop to reunite with Maggie, Sasha, and
Enid; Daryl and Jesus emerge, and the group embraces.  
92 | 9 | "[Rock in the Road](/wiki/Rock_in_the_Road "Rock in the Road")" | Greg Nicotero | Angela Kang | February 12, 2017 (2017-02-12) | 12.00[24]  
After Hilltop rallies behind Rick's group in the fight against the Saviors,
Jesus introduces the group to the Kingdom, where they meet "King" Ezekiel and
reunite with Morgan. Although Ezekiel hesitates to join the proposed alliance,
he offers Daryl asylum at the Kingdom. In Alexandria, a group of Saviors raids
the community in search of Daryl but leaves after they are unable to find him.
Rick's group pursues Father Gabriel, who had taken the group's supplies and
left clues leading to a dilapidated yard. Upon their arrival, the group is
surrounded by the Scavengers.  
93 | 10 | "[New Best Friends](/wiki/New_Best_Friends_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "New Best Friends \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Jeffrey F. January | Channing Powell | February 19, 2017 (2017-02-19) | 11.08[25]  
Rick manages to convince the Scavengers to join Alexandria in the fight
against the Saviors, but their leader, Jadis, demands Rick's group deliver
them guns in exchange for their assistance. Richard plans to have Carol killed
by the Saviors, believing that her death would motivate Ezekiel to fight. When
Daryl learns of Richard's plans, he threatens to kill him should Carol be
harmed in any way. After reuniting with Carol and lying to her about Glenn and
Abraham's fates, Daryl travels to Hilltop to prepare for battle against the
Saviors.  
94 | 11 | "[Hostiles and Calamities](/wiki/Hostiles_and_Calamities "Hostiles and Calamities")" | [Kari Skogland](/wiki/Kari_Skogland "Kari Skogland") | David Leslie Johnson | February 26, 2017 (2017-02-26) | 10.42[26]  
Eugene settles in quickly at the Sanctuary, as he's rewarded for his
intelligence and willingness to submit to Negan's demands. Eugene bonds with
two of Negan's wives. At their request, he makes poison capsules; however, he
refuses to give them the capsules after learning of their intentions to kill
Negan. Dwight discovers a note from Sherry that reveals she helped Daryl
escape from the Sanctuary and then fled to parts unknown. Dwight frames Dr.
Emmett Carson for Daryl and Sherry's disappearances, leading Negan to murder
Carson by hurling him into a furnace.

Rick and Michonne embark on a hunt for guns to bring to the Scavengers and
find an abandoned school carnival, where they acquire dozens of guns. They
bring the guns back to the Scavengers, but Jadis is unsatisfied and demands
more. Tara contemplates whether or not to tell Rick about Oceanside, knowing
Rick's group's need for weapons and reinforcements. Frustrated with the delay,
Rosita travels to Hilltop and meets with Sasha; they make a pact to kill Negan
together.

Ezekiel and his group meet the Saviors for the Kingdom's weekly tribute. After
the Saviors notice a single cantaloupe is missing, Jared shoots Benjamin, who
bleeds to death. Morgan, who finds the missing cantaloupe hidden in the street
and learns that Richard sabotaged the drop-off in an effort to get himself
killed and become a martyr for war, strangles Richard to death for causing
Benjamin's murder. Morgan reveals the truth about Glenn, Abraham, Spencer, and
Olivia to Carol, leading her to return to the Kingdom prepared to fight the
Saviors alongside Ezekiel.

The Saviors raid Hilltop unexpectedly, forcing Daryl and Maggie into hiding;
the Saviors leave with Dr. Harlan Carson in tow to replace his now-deceased
brother as their doctor. While sneaking into the Sanctuary on a secret
mission, Sasha and Rosita encounter Eugene and urge him to escape, but he
refuses. Sasha then locks Rosita out, telling her to go back to Alexandria
because the group needs her. As Sasha breaks into the Sanctuary to kill Negan
herself, Rosita flees and notices someone watching her.  
98 | 15 | "[Something They Need](/wiki/Something_They_Need "Something They Need")" | [Michael Slovis](/wiki/Michael_Slovis "Michael Slovis") | Corey Reed | March 26, 2017 (2017-03-26) | 10.54[30]  
Tara leads the group to Oceanside in hopes of convincing that community to
join the fight against the Saviors. Natania refuses to have her people fight
but ultimately capitulates to Rick's group's demands to take their guns. After
imprisoning Sasha, Negan reveals he is aware of Rick's plans to fight him and
encourages Sasha to join him. She confides in Eugene and asks him for a
weapon, then a way to kill herself; in response, he gives her one of the
poison capsules he had made. Upon their return to Alexandria, Rick's group is
greeted by Rosita, who after running into Dwight while fleeing the Sanctuary,
reveals Dwight's intentions of helping take down Negan.  
99 | 16 | "[The First Day of the Rest of Your Life](/wiki/The_First_Day_of_the_Rest_of_Your_Life_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "The First Day of the Rest of Your Life \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Greg Nicotero | Scott M. Gimple & Angela Kang & Matthew Negrete | April 2, 2017 (2017-04-02) | 11.31[31]  
Negan and the Saviors travel to Alexandria with Sasha in a coffin as a gimmick
to confront Rick. On the way, Sasha commits suicide with the poison capsule
Eugene had given her. At Alexandria, the Scavengers double-cross Rick's group,
revealing they've been dealing with Negan all along. After a standoff, a gun
fight ensues, with the unexpected arrival of Kingdom and Hilltop fighters
forcing Negan and the Saviors and the Scavengers to retreat. Alexandria, the
Kingdom, and Hilltop are hit badly, but are prepared for all-out war against
their enemies, while the undead Sasha is put down by Maggie and Jesus.  
  
##
Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: Reception")]

### Critical
response[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=15
"Edit section: Critical response")]

The seventh season of _The Walking Dead_ has received mixed reviews from
critics. On [Rotten Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"), the
season holds a score of 61% with an [average
rating](/wiki/Weighted_arithmetic_mean "Weighted arithmetic mean") of 6.97 out
of 10, based on 10 reviews, and an average episode score of 77%. The site's
critical consensus reads: "Increased character depth and effective world-
building helps _The Walking Dead_ overcome a tiresome reliance on excessive,
gratuitous violence."[32]

The first episode of the season, "[The Day Will Come When You Won't
Be](/wiki/The_Day_Will_Come_When_You_Won%27t_Be "The Day Will Come When You
Won't Be")", received criticism for the amount of violence depicted in the
episode, with one writer calling it the equivalent of "[torture
porn](/wiki/Splatter_film "Splatter film")".[33] Subsequently, the first half
of the seventh season has seen some of the show's lowest critical ratings. The
show's executive producer [Gale Anne Hurd](/wiki/Gale_Anne_Hurd "Gale Anne
Hurd") claimed that in light of the negative feedback, they tamed some of the
more gruesome scenes that were in episodes being filmed for the second half of
the season. Hurd said that "this is not a show that's torture porn...Let's
make sure we don't cross that line".[34] However, this claim was countered by
executive producers [Scott M. Gimple](/wiki/Scott_M._Gimple "Scott M. Gimple")
and [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero"). Gimple said that the
violence used in the episode was "pronounced for a reason", specifically that
"there was a purpose of traumatizing these characters to a point where maybe
they would have been docile for the rest of their lives", but noted that he
felt that this episode shouldn't represent "the base level of violence that
necessarily should be on the show".[35] On [Rotten
Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"), it holds a 69% with an
[average rating](/wiki/Weighted_arithmetic_mean "Weighted arithmetic mean") of
7.12 out of 10, based on 48 reviews. The site's consensus reads: The
flashback-laden "The Day Will Come When You Won't Be" is slow to deliver the
payoff from last season's finale -- but ultimately delivers with sadistic acts
of gut-wrenching violence that will push _Walking Dead_ fans to their
limit.[36]

###
Accolades[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Accolades")]

See also: [List of awards and nominations received by The Walking
Dead](/wiki/List_of_awards_and_nominations_received_by_The_Walking_Dead "List
of awards and nominations received by The Walking Dead")

For the [43rd Saturn Awards](/wiki/43rd_Saturn_Awards "43rd Saturn Awards"),
the seventh season of _The Walking Dead_ received seven nominations and three
wins. The wins were for [Best Horror Television
Series](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Horror_Television_Series "Saturn Award for
Best Horror Television Series"), [Best Actor on
Television](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Actor_on_Television "Saturn Award for
Best Actor on Television") ([Andrew Lincoln](/wiki/Andrew_Lincoln "Andrew
Lincoln")), and [Best Guest Starring Role on
Television](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Guest_Starring_Role_on_Television
"Saturn Award for Best Guest Starring Role on Television") ([Jeffrey Dean
Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan")).[3] The nominations
were for [Best Supporting Actor on
Television](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Supporting_Actor_on_Television "Saturn
Award for Best Supporting Actor on Television") ([Norman
Reedus](/wiki/Norman_Reedus "Norman Reedus")), [Best Supporting Actress on
Television](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Supporting_Actress_on_Television
"Saturn Award for Best Supporting Actress on Television") ([Danai
Gurira](/wiki/Danai_Gurira "Danai Gurira") and [Melissa
McBride](/wiki/Melissa_McBride "Melissa McBride")), and [Best Performance by a
Younger Actor in a Television
Series](/wiki/Saturn_Award_for_Best_Performance_by_a_Younger_Actor_in_a_Television_Series
"Saturn Award for Best Performance by a Younger Actor in a Television Series")
([Chandler Riggs](/wiki/Chandler_Riggs "Chandler Riggs")).[37]

The first half of the season was nominated for [Outstanding Performance by a
Stunt Ensemble in a Television
Series](/wiki/Screen_Actors_Guild_Award_for_Outstanding_Performance_by_a_Stunt_Ensemble_in_a_Television_Series
"Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Stunt Ensemble in
a Television Series") at the [23rd Screen Actors Guild
Awards](/wiki/23rd_Screen_Actors_Guild_Awards "23rd Screen Actors Guild
Awards").[38] Additionally, for his portrayal of [Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan"),
[Jeffrey Dean Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan") earned
himself a nomination and win for [Best Guest Performer in a Drama
Series](/wiki/Critics%27_Choice_Television_Award_for_Best_Guest_Performer_in_a_Drama_Series
"Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Guest Performer in a Drama Series")
at the [7th Critics' Choice Television
Awards](/wiki/7th_Critics%27_Choice_Television_Awards "7th Critics' Choice
Television Awards") for the first half of the season, in addition to his guest
appearance in the season six finale, "[Last Day on
Earth](/wiki/Last_Day_on_Earth_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Last Day on Earth \(The
Walking Dead\)")".[39][40] Morgan was also nominated at the [26th MTV Movie &
TV Awards](/wiki/2017_MTV_Movie_%26_TV_Awards "2017 MTV Movie & TV Awards")
for Best Actor in a TV Show and [Best
Villain](/wiki/MTV_Movie_Award_for_Best_Villain "MTV Movie Award for Best
Villain"), winning the latter.[41][42]

###
Ratings[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=17
"Edit section: Ratings")]

_The Walking Dead_ 's seventh-season premiere ("[The Day Will Come When You
Won't Be](/wiki/The_Day_Will_Come_When_You_Won%27t_Be "The Day Will Come When
You Won't Be")") received 17.03 million viewers in its initial broadcast on
[AMC](/wiki/AMC_\(TV_channel\) "AMC \(TV channel\)") in the [United
States](/wiki/United_States "United States"). The viewership steadily declined
every week after the premiere, until the seventh episode ("[Sing Me a
Song](/wiki/Sing_Me_a_Song_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Sing Me a Song \(The Walking
Dead\)")"), with the sixth episode ("[Swear](/wiki/Swear_\(The_Walking_Dead\)
"Swear \(The Walking Dead\)")") of the season dropping to 10.40 million
viewers, the lowest rating the show has had since [season
three](/wiki/The_Walking_Dead_\(season_3\) "The Walking Dead \(season 3\)").
Viewing increased to 12 million viewers in the ninth episode ("[Rock in the
Road](/wiki/Rock_in_the_Road "Rock in the Road")"), following this viewing
decreased with the twelfth episode ("[Say
Yes](/wiki/Say_Yes_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Say Yes \(The Walking Dead\)")")
reaching a season low with 10.16 million viewers.[43]

## Home
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_7\)&action=edit&section=18
"Edit section: Home media")]

The season was released on Blu-ray and DVD in [region
1](/wiki/DVD_region_code#Region_codes_and_countries "DVD region code") on
August 22, 2017,[60] in region 2 on September 25, 2017,[61] and in region 4 on
September 27, 2017.[62] The "Limited Edition Spike Walker Statue" set, which
is exclusive to [Amazon.com](/wiki/Amazon.com "Amazon.com") was released on
October 24, 2017, and was created by [McFarlane Toys](/wiki/McFarlane_Toys
"McFarlane Toys") to pay homage to the zombie character featured in the "New
Best Friends" episode in season 7.[63]
